intro: Adenopeltis colliguaya, commonly known as the Colliguaya adenopeltis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
